required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Single Blind, Randomized, Controlled Study to Evaluate the Safety and Effectiveness of EVICEL® as an Adjunct to Gastrointestinal Anastomosis Techniques

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of EVICEL® Fibrin Sealant (Human) for use as an adjunct to gastrointestinal (GI) surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a single blind, randomized, multi-center controlled study evaluating the safety and effectiveness of EVICEL® when used as an adjunct to gastrointestinal (GI) surgery.

arm_group.description: EVICEL is a human plasma-derived fibrin sealant composed of two components - thrombin and fibrinogen.
Standard surgical technique for GI anastomosis.
EVICEL is a human plasma-derived fibrin sealant composed of two components - thrombin and fibrinogen

group.title: Experimental: EVICEL Fibrin Sealant: Non-Randomized
group.description: EVICEL is a human plasma-derived fibrin sealant composed of two components - thrombin and fibrinogen EVICEL Fibrin Sealant: Intraoperative

baseline.population: Subjects enrolled who consented and were randomized into the study or assigned to the non-randomized portion and had the investigational product applied were included in the analysis sets. The Safety Set consists of 125 subjects treated with EVICEL (41 Non- Randomized) and 89 subjects treated with Standard of Care.

outcome.title: Incidence of GI Leak
outcome.population: The primary endpoint was absence of leak (success) within 40 days. Any data missing was considered failures. 3 EVICEL and 2 SoC subjects had missing data. These subjects were considered failures for the primary endpoint. The secondary endpoint was incidence of leak within 90 days post operatively. Missing data was not assumed to be leaks.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
